net.canarymod.api.inventory

Interface Item

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public interface Item
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    This wraps an item stack
    Author:
    Chris (damagefilter), Jason (darkdiplomat), Jos

      • isEnchanted

        boolean isEnchanted()
        gets whether this item is enchanted
        Returns:
        true if enchanted; false if not

      • isEnchantable

        boolean isEnchantable()
        Returns whether this item is enchantable. Uses the same logic as anvils to determine whether an item is enchantable.
        Returns:
        true if this item is enchantable, false otherwise

      • getEnchantment

        Enchantment getEnchantment()
        gets the first enchantment of this item if exists
        Returns:
        the first Enchantment

      • getEnchantment

        Enchantment getEnchantment(int index)
        gets the enchantment at the specified index if exists
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the enchantment to get
        Returns:
        the Enchantment at the index or null

      • getEnchantments

        Enchantment[] getEnchantments()
        gets an array of enchantments for this item if they exist
        Returns:
        an Enchantment array

      • addEnchantments

        void addEnchantments(Enchantment... enchantments)
        adds enchantments to this item
        Parameters:
        enchantments - the Enchantment(s) to add

        sets this item's enchantments (removes all others)

        enchantments - the Enchantment(s) to set

        void removeEnchantment(Enchantment enchantment)

        enchantment - the Enchantment to remove

      • removeAllEnchantments

        void removeAllEnchantments()
        removes all enchantments from this item

      • hasDisplayName

        boolean hasDisplayName()
        Checks if this item has a display name.
        Returns:
        true if has name; false if not

      • getDisplayName

        java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        Gets the visible name of this item. Names can be set using an anvil or setDisplayName(String).
        Returns:
        The item name

      • setDisplayName

        void setDisplayName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the visible name of this item. Equivalent to renaming this item using an anvil.
        Parameters:
        name - The item's new name

      • removeDisplayName

        void removeDisplayName()
        Removes the display name if present

        int getRepairCost()
        Gets the cost to repair the Item
        Returns:
        repair cost

        void setRepairCost(int cost)
        Sets the cost to repair the Item
        Parameters:
        cost - the repair cost

      • getLore

        java.lang.String[] getLore()
        Returns the text that shows up under this item's name in the player's inventory.
        Returns:
        the lore or null if no lore

      • setLore

        void setLore(java.lang.String... lore)
        Sets the text that shows up under the item's name in the player's inventory
        Parameters:
        lore - The lore to set, each line should be in a separate string in the array

      • hasLore

        boolean hasLore()
        Checks if the Item has lore
        Returns:
        true if has lore; false if not

      • hasMetaTag

        boolean hasMetaTag()
        Checks if the Item has a MetaTag or not
        Returns:
        true if MetaTag is present; false otherwise
        See Also:
        getMetaTag()

      • getMetaTag

        CompoundTag getMetaTag()
        Returns an CompoundTag that is saved with this object.
        This tag is for plugin use only.
        Changing values in this tag will not affect the behavior of the object.
        Returns:
        the CompoundTag of special metadata

      • hasDataTag

        boolean hasDataTag()
        Checks if the Item has a DataTag
        Returns:
        true if has DataTag; false if not

      • getDataTag

        CompoundTag getDataTag()
        Gets the tag containing data for this item. Should be named 'tag'. Setting this to null removes name and lore data.
        Returns:
        the data tag

      • setDataTag

        void setDataTag(CompoundTag tag)
        Sets the tag containing data for this item. Should be named 'tag'. Setting this to null removes name and lore data.
        Parameters:
        tag - the data tag

      • writeToTag

        CompoundTag writeToTag(CompoundTag tag)
        Writes this item's data to an NBTTagCompound.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag to write to
        Returns:
        CompoundTag

      • readFromTag

        void readFromTag(CompoundTag tag)
        Sets this item's data to that in an CompoundTag.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag to read from

      • clone

        Item clone()
        Clones the Item
        Returns:
        clone of the Item

      • getAttributes

        <any> getAttributes()
        Gets the Multimap of Attributes
        Returns:
        attributes multimap

      • updateAttributes

        void updateAttributes(<any> attributeMap)
        Updates the native Multimap of Attributes
        Parameters:
        attributeMap - the attribute map to be set

      • equalsIgnoreSize

        boolean equalsIgnoreSize(Item item)
        Checks if this item is equal to another item, ignoring stack size
        Parameters:
        item - the Item to compare to.
        Returns:
        true if both items have the same type, damage and data. false otherwise
